programme.title: Live: 20/20
programme.desc: Award-winning program featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Quigley Down Under
programme.desc: An Old West sharpshooter goes to Australia, where his new boss expects him to kill Aboriginal Australians.

programme.title: 12 Angry Men
programme.desc: One (Henry Fonda) of 12 jurors holds out in the case of a boy from the slums who is accused of killing his father.

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor
programme.desc: A money launderer (Stellan Skarsgard) for Russian gangsters asks a couple vacationing in Marrakech, Morocco, to deliver incriminating evidence to an MI6 agent (Damian Lewis).

programme.title: Bones and All
programme.desc: Love blossoms between a young woman on the margins of society and a disenfranchised drifter as they embark on a 3,000-mile odyssey through the backroads of America.

programme.title: Into the Wild
programme.desc: A top student and athlete leaves his middle-class life to venture into Alaska, only to meet people who will eventually shape his values and life.

programme.title: The Last Castle
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: Enemy at the Gates
programme.desc: A Nazi sniper (Ed Harris) travels to Stalingrad to find and kill a Russian sharpshooter (Jude Law), the hero of the propaganda campaign of a political officer (Joseph Fiennes).

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise) goes on the lam to uncover the truth behind a major government conspiracy that involves the death of U.S. soldiers.

programme.title: Novocaine
programme.desc: When the girl of his dreams gets kidnapped, a man turns his inability to feel pain into an unexpected advantage. He fights a bunch of thugs to get her back.

programme.title: Ronin
programme.desc: An Irish ringleader (Natascha McElhone) organizes an international team of hired guns (Robert De Niro, Jean Reno) to retrieve a briefcase from criminals.

programme.title: The Delta Force
programme.desc: Terrorists reroute a passenger jet from Athens to Beirut, where commandos (Chuck Norris, Lee Marvin) are waiting to negotiate.

programme.title: Catch-22
programme.desc: Air Force officers try to cope with the insanity of World War II in this adaptation of Joseph Heller's novel.

programme.title: Max 2: White House Hero
programme.desc: Max, a military service dog, is assigned to serve on the U.S. president's Secret Service detail.

programme.title: Where to Invade Next
programme.desc: Filmmaker Michael Moore visits various countries, including France, Italy, Germany, Finland and Slovenia, to examine how Europeans view work, education, health care, sex, equality, and other issues.

programme.title: Nickel Boys
programme.desc: Elwood Curtis' college dreams are shattered when he's sentenced to a brutal reformatory in the Jim Crow South. Clinging to his optimistic worldview, Elwood strikes up a friendship with a fellow Black teen who dispenses fundamental tips for survival.

programme.title: Thelma & Louise
programme.desc: An Arkansas waitress (Susan Sarandon) and a housewife (Geena Davis) shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.

programme.title: Blink Twice
programme.desc: When tech billionaire Slater King meets Frida, he invites her to join him and his friends for a dream vacation on his private island. However, when strange things start to happen, she'll have to uncover the truth if she hopes to make it out alive.

programme.title: Gorky Park
programme.desc: A Moscow detective's investigation of a bizarre triple murder leads him to run-ins with the KGB and an American tycoon.

programme.title: Witness
programme.desc: An eight-year-old Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder in a Philadelphia train station. The Philadelphia police captain discovers that the murderers are cops trying to squelch a corruption investigation.

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: Belgian sleuth Hercule Poirot investigates an American industrialist's murder aboard the world-famous luxury train.

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A CIA bookworm (Robert Redford) reports mayhem to his boss (Cliff Robertson), then hides out with a woman (Faye Dunaway) and sees a conspiracy.

programme.title: Gone Girl
programme.desc: A man reports that his wife has gone missing on their fifth wedding anniversary, but his public portrait of their blissful union begins to crumble under police pressure and a growing media frenzy.

programme.title: Let the Devil In
programme.desc: The town of Jefferson faces a mystery; how does a son murder his mother so brutally and die by suicide in such a seemingly impossible way?; as investigators uncover an obsession with Satan, whispers of demonic possession grow.

programme.title: Torn Hearts
programme.desc: A country music duo seek out the private mansion of their idol and end up in a twisted series of horrors that force them to confront the limits they'd go for their dreams.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: Seaton Smith performs a set loaded with relationship advice and "white positive" jokes; Yedoye Travis also covers race relations while making the argument that the devil is actually white.

programme.title: The Misfits
programme.desc: A divorcee (Marilyn Monroe) joins an old cowboy (Clark Gable) and his partners rounding up wild horses for dog food.

programme.title: Tommy's Honour
programme.desc: Tom and Tommy Morris, father and son pioneers of professional golf, relied on skill, business acumen and working-class street smarts to make Tommy one of the world's first sports superstars and found the modern game of golf.

programme.title: Snack Shack
programme.desc: Best friends AJ and Moose seize the opportunity to run the local pool's rundown snack shack. However, things take an unexpected turn when they meet Brooke, an effortlessly cool lifeguard who puts their big summer plans -- and friendship -- at risk.

programme.title: Escape From Alcatraz
programme.desc: A hardened con with a history of prison breaks, is sent to serve the rest of his life sentence at Alcatraz, America's most infamously brutal and inescapable maximum security prison.

programme.title: Missing in Action
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Missing in Action 2: The Beginning
programme.desc: An imprisoned U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) fights the military overlord (Oh Soon-tek) of a slave-labor opium operation in Vietnam.

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: A pacifist farmer (Mel Gibson) of South Carolina reluctantly joins the Revolutionary War and fights alongside his son (Heath Ledger).

programme.title: Air Force One
programme.desc: Demanding the release of a political prisoner, a terrorist and his gang hijack the U.S. president's plane.

programme.title: A Working Man
programme.desc: Levon Cade left behind a military career in the black ops to live a simple life. However, when human traffickers kidnap his boss's daughter, his search to bring her home uncovers a world of corruption far greater than he ever could have imagined.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: U.S. soldiers encounter heavy fire while trying to capture a warlord's associates in Mogadishu, Somalia.

programme.title: A House on the Bayou: Trailer
programme.desc: A troubled couple and their teenage daughter go on vacation to an isolated house in the Louisiana bayou to reconnect as a family. When unexpected visitors arrive, their facade of family unity starts to unravel, as terrifying secrets come to light.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A social misfit (Sissy Spacek) with psychic powers wreaks havoc at her prom to get even with pranksters.

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy
programme.desc: An inventor (Woody Allen), his wife (Mary Steenburgen) and two other couples spend an enchanted circa-1900 country weekend.

programme.title: Alive
programme.desc: Following the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, injured veterans turn to adaptive athletics to heal their physical and emotional battle wounds.

programme.title: Boo! A Madea Halloween
programme.desc: Cranky, fast-talking Madea (Tyler Perry) finds herself under attack from ghosts, ghouls and zombies after breaking up a fraternity's Halloween party.

programme.title: September 5
programme.desc: During the 1972 Munich Olympics, an American sports broadcasting crew finds itself thrust into covering the hostage crisis involving Israeli athletes.
In 1946, Branch Rickey (Harrison Ford), general manager of the Brooklyn Dodgers, signs Jackie Robinson (Chadwick Boseman) to the team in defiance of major league baseball's notorious color barrier.

programme.title: Universal Soldier
programme.desc: Dead soldiers from the '60s surface in the '90s as high-tech warriors reanimated by the U.S. government.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: The musketeers rescue their king's true heir from the Bastille.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A prince (Jack Huston) endures years of slavery to take vengeance on his adopted brother (Toby Kebbell), a Roman officer who falsely accused him of treason.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: Enraged by the killing of his wife, Scotsman William Wallace (Mel Gibson) leads a revolt against the tyrannical English king (Patrick McGoohan) in the 13th century.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: During the era of Tammany Hall's sway, a young man (Leonardo DiCaprio) vows vengeance on the vicious gangster (Daniel Day-Lewis) who killed his father.

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: Telling fortunes to support herself and her daughter, a psychic widow (Cate Blanchett) assists the police in a missing persons case.

programme.title: Sex Life
programme.desc: An erotic sleepover; the seduction of VR porn; rekindling one's sex life after a long illness.

programme.title: The Honey Trap: A True Story of Love, Lies and the FBI
programme.desc: The story of Denis Cuspert, aka Deso Dogg, and his journey from infamous German rapper to ISIS recruiter; exploring the circular relationship between propaganda, recruitment and the soft power of entertainment culture.

programme.title: The Fabulous Four
programme.desc: Lifelong friends travel to Key West, Fla., to be bridesmaids in a college girlfriend's surprise wedding. Sisterhoods are rekindled, the past resurfaces, and there are enough sparks, sex and romance to change all of their lives in unexpected ways.

programme.title: The Girl in the Pool
programme.desc: A man's life collapses when his mistress is found dead in his pool. Terrified of the consequences and desperate to protect his family, he conceals the truth, triggering a chaotic night that threatens to unravel his perfect life.

programme.title: Awake
programme.desc: A young man (Hayden Christensen) who is undergoing surgery experiences anesthesia awareness, which leaves him alert but paralyzed and unable to warn his doctors.

programme.title: The Firm
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldn't refuse.

programme.title: Green Book
programme.desc: An Italian-American bouncer and an African-American pianist confront racism and danger while taking a road trip through the Deep South in 1962.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: A Marine (Matthew Modine) and his companions (Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio) endure basic training under a sadistic drill sergeant and fight in the 1968 Tet offensive.

programme.title: Piñero
programme.desc: Poet, playwright and actor Miguel Piñero (Benjamin Bratt) spends time in jail for theft and drug dealing.

programme.title: Frida
programme.desc: Mexican painter Frida Kahlo (Salma Hayek) marries fellow artist Diego Rivera who shares her radical political views.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: A Marine (Matthew Modine) and his companions (Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio) endure basic training under a sadistic drill sergeant and fight in the 1968 Tet offensive.

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: Paratroopers drop behind enemy lines to penetrate a fortified church and destroy a Nazi transmitter. Making their way to an underground lab, the soldiers stumble upon a sinister experiment that forces them into a battle against an army of the undead.

programme.title: You Hurt My Feelings
programme.desc: A novelist's long-standing marriage is suddenly upended when she overhears her husband give his honest reaction to her latest book.

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: On his maiden voyage to Earth, the first human (Asa Butterfield) born on Mars experiences the joys and wonders of a new world while trying to unravel the mysteries of his existence.

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: An FBI agent (John Travolta) and his nemesis (Nicolas Cage) trade physical identities.

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: A Southern lawyer (Matthew McConaughey) and his legal assistant (Sandra Bullock) defend a black man (Samuel L. Jackson) for killing his young daughter's white attackers.

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan
programme.desc: A senatorial candidate (Ralph Fiennes) falls for a chambermaid (Jennifer Lopez) after he mistakes her for a guest (Natasha Richardson) at the hotel.

programme.title: The Back-up Plan
programme.desc: A single woman (Jennifer Lopez) meets the man (Alex O'Loughlin) of her dreams on the same day she becomes pregnant through artificial insemination.

programme.title: Winter Spring Summer or Fall
programme.desc: Young Remi has her future figured out, until she meets Barnes, who lives for the moment and makes her question everything. As their love story unfolds, she faces a choice -- stick to her plan or risk it all for a life she never saw coming.

programme.title: Geostorm
programme.desc: When the satellites designed to control the global climate starts to attack Earth, it's a race to uncover the real threat before a worldwide Geostorm wipes out everything and everyone.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Terror strikes when astronauts (Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds) aboard the International Space Station discover a rapidly evolving life-form from Mars that threatens Earth.

programme.title: Approaching the Unknown
programme.desc: An American astronaut (Mark Strong) tests his will, sanity and endurance while embarking on a one-way, solo mission to Mars.

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: A 1950s lawman (Leonardo DiCaprio) pursues a murderess who appears to have vanished from a locked room within a fortresslike psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Panama
programme.desc: A defense contractor hires an ex-marine to go to Panama to complete an arms deal. In the process, he becomes involved in the U.S. invasion of Panama.

programme.title: Monster Summer
programme.desc: A mysterious force disrupts Noah and his friends' summer fun. They team up with a retired police detective to embark on a monstrous adventure to save their island.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: A plucky youngster (Quvenzhané Wallis) escapes the clutches of her calculating foster mother and charms her way into the heart of a hard-nosed tycoon (Jamie Foxx), who's running for mayor.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: A Beverly Hills teen (Alicia Silverstone) plays matchmaker for teachers, transforms a bad dresser (Brittany Murphy) and examines her own existence.

programme.title: The Wedding Banquet
programme.desc: Hoping to stay in the country, a gay man proposes a green card marriage to a female friend in exchange for paying for her IVF treatment. However, things get complicated when his grandmother surprises them with an extravagant Korean wedding banquet.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A girl makes a wish on her thirteenth birthday, and wakes up the next day as a thirty-year-old woman.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone
programme.desc: Two private investigators (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) tread dangerous ground as they scour the Boston underworld for a kidnapped child.

programme.title: Safe
programme.desc: A young girl whose memory holds a priceless numerical code, finds herself pursued. Coming to her aid is an ex-cage fighter whose life was destroyed by the gangsters on Mei's trail.

programme.title: The Untouchables
programme.desc: Though Prohibition agent Eliot Ness attempts to take Al Capone down, even his best efforts fail due to widespread corruption within the Windy City's police force.

programme.title: Reunion
programme.desc: Deaf man Daniel Brennan is leaving prison after ten isolating years inside and is now a man on a mission for revenge. Shunned by his parents and community, Brennan has nothing left to lose, until he is reunited with his estranged daughter, Carly.

programme.title: The Wedding Banquet
programme.desc: Hoping to stay in the country, a gay man proposes a green card marriage to a female friend in exchange for paying for her IVF treatment. However, things get complicated when his grandmother surprises them with an extravagant Korean wedding banquet.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: At a Texas penitentiary, jailed NFL veterans (Adam Sandler, Burt Reynolds) train their fellow inmates for a football game against the guards.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: A Beverly Hills teen (Alicia Silverstone) plays matchmaker for teachers, transforms a bad dresser (Brittany Murphy) and examines her own existence.

programme.title: Talk to Me
programme.desc: When a group of friends discover how to conjure spirits with an embalmed hand, they become hooked on the new thrill and high-stakes party game -- until one of them goes too far and unleashes terrifying supernatural forces.

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: Jack Ryan (Ben Affleck) and the CIA director (Morgan Freeman) try to stop terrorists who are planning a nuclear attack.

programme.title: Past Lives
programme.desc: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Decades later, they are reunited for one fateful week as they confront destiny, love and the choices that make a life.

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: Unauthorized to enter the United States, an Eastern European (Tom Hanks) befriends a flight attendant (Catherine Zeta-Jones) while living in a New York airport.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: An armored-car driver (Zach Galifianakis) helps a flirty co-worker (Kristen Wiig) and her friends pull off a heist, then finds himself holding the bag after they double-cross him.

programme.title: Ride
programme.desc: Desperate to raise money for his daughter's cancer treatment, a retired bull rider teams up with his estranged son to orchestrate a robbery. However, they must soon outwit the local police if they want to keep the cash and their freedom.

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: While in jail for murdering her husband (Bruce Greenwood), a woman (Ashley Judd) discovers he is living under a new identity with their son.

programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: The commander (Harrison Ford) of a Russian submarine tries to avert a disaster after a nuclear reactor malfunctions.

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: A Marine (Matthew Modine) and his companions (Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio) endure basic training under a sadistic drill sergeant and fight in the 1968 Tet offensive.

programme.title: Blade
programme.desc: A man (Wesley Snipes) with vampire blood and his mortal partner (Kris Kristofferson) hunt a rebel vampire (Stephen Dorff) and his coterie of undead.

programme.title: Blade II
programme.desc: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.

programme.title: Blade: Trinity
programme.desc: Blade (Wesley Snipes) and a pair of vampire slayers battle Dracula, the newly resurrected ancestor of the undead.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity
programme.desc: A young couple (Katie Featherston, Micah Sloat) move into their first new home but are disturbed by what appears to be a supernatural presence that is most active at night.

programme.title: Scary Movie 2
programme.desc: Psychology students and their professor spend the weekend in a haunted house in this sendup of horror films.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy (2020)
programme.desc: In this teen drama-fantasy film, a bullied newcomer joins forces with three other high school students to establish a culturally diverse coven of witches. As they make mischief and individually explore their newfound occult powers, they begin to realize that magic comes at a price.

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter (2015)
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance.

programme.title: You're Next (2013)
programme.desc: Crispian and his new girlfriend Erin attend a family reunion that turns into a feral massacre when a gang of masked killers invade a sprawling country mansion on a ruthless mission of murder.

programme.title: The Outfit (2022)
programme.desc: Leonard is an English tailor who used to craft suits on London's world-famous Savile Row. After a personal tragedy, he's ended up in Chicago, operating a small tailor shop in a rough part of town where he makes beautiful clothes for the only people around who can afford them: a family of vicious gangsters.

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter (2015)
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance.

programme.title: Winchester (2018)
programme.desc: An heiress to the Winchester fortune orders the construction of a huge house on isolated land outside of San Francisco, but her reasons for having the edifice built are unclear to all those around her.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy (2020)
programme.desc: In this teen drama-fantasy film, a bullied newcomer joins forces with three other high school students to establish a culturally diverse coven of witches. As they make mischief and individually explore their newfound occult powers, they begin to realize that magic comes at a price.

programme.title: Leatherface (2017)
programme.desc: A disturbed teen named Jackson breaks out of a mental hospital with the help of three fellow inmates. The group take a nurse hostage, and are soon hunted by a vengeful Texas Ranger in this bloodcurdling horror prequel.

programme.title: Olympus Has Fallen (2013)
programme.desc: An ex-Secret Service agent fights back against terrorists who have taken over the White House and kidnapped the president. Trapped by hostile forces, he must prevent the incident from spiralling into all-out war.

programme.title: London Has Fallen (2016)
programme.desc: A secret service agent, the President of the United States and an MI-6 Agent must work together to stop a terrorist plot to assassinate world leaders and destroy landmarks in the city of London.

programme.title: Glass (2019)
programme.desc: Following the events of Split, David Dunn begins an investigation into Kevin Wendell Crumb's disturbing alias The Beast. But as he dives deeper into Wendell's crimes, shadowy mastermind 'Mr. Glass' reveals himself to hold information critical to both men.

programme.title: The Outfit (2022)
programme.desc: Leonard is an English tailor who used to craft suits on London's world-famous Savile Row. After a personal tragedy, he's ended up in Chicago, operating a small tailor shop in a rough part of town where he makes beautiful clothes for the only people around who can afford them: a family of vicious gangsters.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: In his third series appearance, Jack Klugman plays one of three astronauts who find their lifeless look-alikes in a crashed spaceship on a distant planet. Mason: Ross Martin. Carter: Fredrick Beir. Ruth: Mary Webster. Jeannie: Tammy Marihugh. Kramer: Ross Elliott. Mrs. Nolan: Sara Taft.

programme.title: Jacuzzi Bath Remodel
programme.desc: Trusted brand Jacuzzi Bath Remodel and interior designer Christina Hall share their secrets on how you can easily and affordably transform your bathroom into a gorgeous custom, safe, stylish space in 1 day! Call for a FREE quote & installation.

programme.title: The Aging Brain
programme.desc: Learn what's behind mental decline with age, and how to improve memory, focus and concentration with NeuroQ's Darrin Peterson and Dale Bredesen MD.

programme.title: The Rate Escape Cut Cell Bills
programme.desc: Cut up to HALF the cost of your monthly cell phone bill. Same Towers. Same Coverage. But a LOT less money. It sounds great but is it too good to be true? Join myth-busting legend Kari Byron as she takes on Big Wireless to save you money.

programme.title: Horizon Line (2020)
programme.desc: A couple flying on a small plane to attend a tropical island wedding must fight for their lives after their pilot suffers a heart attack.

programme.title: Texas Chainsaw 3D (2013)
programme.desc: In this shocking sequel that picks up where the legendary 1974 horror film "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" ended, a young woman inherits a mansion in rural Texas that holds a terrifying secret from her family's twisted past.

programme.title: Leatherface (2017)
programme.desc: A disturbed teen named Jackson breaks out of a mental hospital with the help of three fellow inmates. The group take a nurse hostage, and are soon hunted by a vengeful Texas Ranger in this bloodcurdling horror prequel.

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
programme.desc: A bodyguard must protect a hit man who's about to testify against a dictator.

programme.title: The Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard (2021)
programme.desc: Assassin Darius Kincaid faces unprecedented territory as his wife Sonia becomes the latest target amongst his countless enemies. Darius then calls in a favor from his longtime friend, bodyguard Michael Bryce, to rescue Sonia and thwart the sinister designs of their mutual foes.

programme.title: The First Purge (2018)
programme.desc: A prequel recounting events that led up to the first Purge event. To push the crime rate below one percent for the rest of the year, the New Founding Fathers of America (NFFA) test a sociological theory that vents aggression for one night in one isolated community.

programme.title: Glass (2019)
programme.desc: Following the events of Split, David Dunn begins an investigation into Kevin Wendell Crumb's disturbing alias The Beast. But as he dives deeper into Wendell's crimes, shadowy mastermind 'Mr. Glass' reveals himself to hold information critical to both men.

programme.title: Child's Play (2019)
programme.desc: After moving to a new city, a mother gives her 13-year-old son a toy doll for his birthday, unaware of its sinister nature. When her son realizes the doll took on a life of its own, he unites with other neighborhood children to stop the doll from wreaking havoc.

programme.title: The First Purge (2018)

programme.title: Blackwater Lane (2024)
programme.desc: Witnessing a roadside murder on a desolate highway, Cass starts to question her own sanity. Haunted by a chilling presence, Cass witnesses more terrifying events that slowly push her to the edge. She then questions whether she can unravel the dark plot before becoming the killer's next target.

programme.title: Stillwater (2021)
programme.desc: Bill, an American redneck from Oklahoma is forced to fly to Marseille to help his daughter who is currently languishing in jail for a murder charge. Allison maintains her innocence but French authorities and the country's legal system will not let her out easily, so Bill decides to stay and exhaust all possibilities for exonerating her from all charges.

programme.desc: Rex tries to frame Prue for stealing a tiara by manipulating the sisters---and the police---with a process in which he implants subliminal thoughts in their heads. Also: Piper and Leo explore new territory.

programme.desc: Prue has a bad feeling about Phoebe's visiting old flame, but still agrees to auction off an urn he acquired in Egypt---unaware the piece is not only stolen, but also cursed. Meanwhile, Phoebe gets reacquainted with her ex; and Piper helps a co-worker.

programme.title: Charmed

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The Halliwells' mum warns them about a demon who arrives every 1300 years on Friday the 13th to literally scare witches to death and feed on their fear. Also: Phoebe has misgivings about a job; Piper lets superstitions dictate her interest in a potential suitor.

programme.title: Charmed

programme.desc: The 1985 murder of a corrupt stockbroker who swindled thousands of people out of their money is reopened after one of the dead man's protégés comes forward with new information, which he's willing to exchange for a lighter sentence now that he's in trouble with the law. programme.desc: The sisters travel back to the 1970s to prevent their mum from making a pact with a warlock that makes him immune to their powers. Unfortunately, their mum---who's pregnant with Phoebe---and grandmother think the ladies are warlocks.

programme.desc: Lilly reopens a presumed homicide from 1979 in which a Jane Doe's blood-drenched shoes, underwear and sheets are found in a trash bag, but no body.
